question: process of averaging improves the {{c1::Signal to Noise Ratio (S:N)}} by a factor that is the square root of the number of averages performed.
answer: This averaging process extracts the desired neurophysiologic signal from larger noise and interference signals S:N= { Signal amplitude × √# of averages performed} / Noise amplitude Interference = unwanted signals occurring from outside the system being studied Noise = unwanted signals occurring from within the system (eg. electrical outlets, fluorescent lights)
